DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
J. M.Rosolen é Livre-Docente na Universidade de São Paulo-Dep. de Química (2004), FFCLRP onde ingressou em 08/1997. Possui graduação (1988) e mestrado (1991) em Física-IFGW-Unicamp onde ingressou apos realizar seus estudos em escola pública. Seu Doutorado Pleno em Ciências Químicas (1992) foi obtido na Universidade de Roma La Sapienza. Sua formação foi orientada pelos Professores Franco Decker -IFGW (Fisica de Semicondutores, Eletroquímica, Fotoeletroquímica e Celulas Solares) e Bruno Scrosati (sistemas de conversão e armazenagem de energia-baterias, capacitores). Realizou vários pos-doc e sabáticos (Lab. de Compostos de Intercalação, Baterias de Na/S, Espectroscopia de Absorção de raios-X com luz Syncrontron na Univ. de Camerino-1995/ Grupo de Eletroquímica Inst. de Química de São Carlos, Lab. de Combustíveis Alternativos ?IFGW-Unicamp-1996-97/ Lab. de Baterias de Ions de Litio e Capacitores da Italian National Agency for new technologies, energy and enviroment-ENEA-Italy (2007-Stefano Passerini)/ Centro de Nanotecnologia ATI da Faculdade de Engenharia Eletronica da Universidade de Surrey- Ravi Silva-Inglaterra (2005)/ Instituto de Ciências de Los Materiales de Madrid-ICMM Espanha-Fundação Carolina (2009-Dino Tonti). Trabalha no DQ-FFCLRP-USP desde 1998 onde estabeleceu seu laboratório de pesquisas. Na área de ensino ministra disciplinas de Fisico-Química, Eletroquímica e na pós graduação é responsável por disciplina de Nanotecnologia em óxidos e materiais carbonáceos. Seus estudos acadêmicos e tecnológicos estão concentrados em duas linhas de pesquisa: Na linha 1 explora a multidisciplinaridade da área de nanoestruturas de carbono produzidas no seu laboratório (nanotubos de carbono, grafeno reduzido e oxido de grafeno). Vários projetos colaborativos tem sido realizados nesta linha envolvendo processos de adsorção de substâncias químicas em filtros de nanoestruturas de carbono, reforço mecânico de plásticos, sensores amperométricos ou resistivos, aplicações biológicas visando o entendimento da cito e genotoxicidade e materiais híbridos e hierárquicos de interesse para eletroquímica e catálise heterogênea.
Na linha 2 o foco principal é concentrado na área de conversão e armazenagem eletroquímica de energia onde estuda e desenvolve os componentes usados na preparação dos dispositivos como baterias redox, fluxo Zn/Ar, células combustíveis, intercalação com Li e Na, supercapacitores e hibridos de baterias-supercapacitores. Particular enfase é dada nos eletrodos ( non-wovens electrodes, free-binder electrodes, core-shell, oxidos, materiais carbonáceos, compositos de nanoestruturas de carbono/nanopartículas). Seus estudos nesta linha também envolvem a montagem de protótipos de ions de Li, ions de Na, Zn/Ar, supercapacitores. Estas duas linhas de pesquisas foram germinadas em 1998 após o seu regresso do seu PhD no exterior. Em ambas as linhas são realizados esforços que visam a transferência do conhecimento acadêmico para o setor produtivo. Possui depósitos de patentes e cartas patentes ligadas a área de armazenagem de energia, filtros e aditivos para plásticos de engenharia. No caso de baterias tem colaborado com empresas do setor de mineração e empresas interessadas no desenvolvimento de piloto de baterias de ions de Li, enquanto na nanotecnologia de carbono o alvo prioritário tem sido empresas de polímeros (reforço mecânico e condutividade eletrônica). Particular atenção é dedicada a linha de produção dos dispositivos e dos respectivos pilotos envolvidos. Atua como consultor de empresas de mineração, baterias e nanotecnologia. Do ponto de vista de internacionalização, suas pesquisas tem promovido colaborações com Alemanha Ulm-Helmoltz Institute, Universidade Tecnica de Cheminitz, Itália-Universidade de Camerino, Espanha- Universidade computense de Madrid e Centro de Materaiais de Barcelona ,USA-North Caroline Nonwovens e University of Surrey -ATI.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Bacharelado Em Fisica from Universidade Estadual de Campinas (1988), master's at Physic from Universidade Estadual de Campinas (1991) and doctorate at Dottorato Di Ricerca In Scienze Chimiche from Universita Degli Studi Di Roma La Sapienza (1995). Has experience in Chemistry, acting on the following subjects: nanotubos de carbono, oxidos, baterias, exafs and nanotubos.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento e estudo de materiais eletródicos e de baterias tipo celas de concentração (FAPESP 96/05347-1)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O presente projeto trata-se de um auxilio jovem pesquisador (96/05347-1) que permitiu o inicio das instalações do laboratório de materiais e de baterias de ions de Li que entrou em operação em 1998. 
A linha de pesquisa realizado neste projeto envolveu:

Produção de óxidos ( sinterização LiCoO2, LiNiO2, LiNixCo1-xO2 partindo-se por varias rotas ja conhecidas e desenvolvidas pelo grupo)
Desenvolvimento de tecnicas de preparação de eletrodos compósitos
Estudo de baterias LiCoO2/grafite
Desenvolvimento de eletrodos de pirita natural e por spray-pirólise
Estudo mecanistico da intercalação de Li nos materiais acima com
várias tecnicas estruturais (XRD, EXAFS, XANES, Microscopia, FTIR) e eletroquimicas

valores concedidos no projeto exceto bolsas:

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de baterias Li/V2O5 e C/V2O5
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O presente projeto trata-se de um PADCT-III categoria individual (620238/97-6) que também permitiu a finalização da montagem do laboratório do atual grupo.
A linha de pesquisa realizado neste projeto envolveu:

Produção de óxidos V2O5 por método xero-gel
Desenvolvimento de um novo tipo de carbono a partir do bagaço da cana-de-açúcar
Estudo de moagens e vários tratamentos térmicos, mecanicos e quimicos de grafite natural em 
parceria com a empresa Nacional de Grafite
Desenvolvimento de tecnicas de preparação de eletrodos compósitos
Estudo de baterias V2O5/grafite e V2O5/Li
Estudo mecanistico da intercalação de Li nos materiais acima com
várias tecnicas estruturais (XRD, EXAFS, XANES, FTIR), morfológicas (microscopia, BET) e eletroquimicas.

valores concedidos no projeto exceto bolsas: 
R$60.477,00 and $134838,00

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Melhoria da Infra-Estrutura de Pesquisa dos Departamentos de Quimica, Fisica e Matemática-FFCLRP
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O presente projeto consistiu na reforma de grande parte das linhas elétricas dos blocos do Dep. de Quimica, Fisica e Matemática . Foram refeitas e ampliados varios quadros de forças, seraparadas as linhas de equipamentos daquelas de ar condicionado, além de uma serie de instalações na casa se força. Mediçoes de terra e correçoes dos mesmos também foram realizados.

Total da reforma: R$ 148 918,00 (PROJETO INFRA-ESTRUTURA 98/09506-2)

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: DESENVOLVIMENTO E ESTUDO DE NANOTUBOS INTERESSANTES PARA ARMAZENAGEM ELETROQUÍMICA DE ENERGIA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto trata do desenvolvimento e estudo de nanotubos interessantes para área de energia com ênfase em baterias de íons de lítio.
O projeto irá produzir nanotubos a partir dos métodos de arco e CVD. No caso do método de arco será ênfase no estudo de catalisadores que melhorem o rendimento do reator. Para o método CVD o projeto pretende investir na produção e estudo de nanotubos sob substratos catalisados por óxidos.No âmbito da aplicação destes nanotubos o projeto escolhe como dispositivo um sistema de grande importância econômica: baterias de íons de lítio, um sistema de armazenamento de energia extremamente flexível e que já se afirmou no mercado de baterias para sistemas eletrônicos de comunicação e outros equipamentos portáteis. Neste contexto, os nanotubos obtidos serão submetidos à vários tipos de tratamentos de purificação, abertura e modificação química. Eletroquímica de estado sólido, métodos de investigação estrutural e microscópica deverão aplicarse para abordar questões fundamentais ligadas ao processo de intercalação de íons de lítio em anodos compósitos de nanotubos.
As principais técnicas de estudo no projeto:
são as microscópicas HRTEM, TEM, SEM, Raman, BET
e as eletroquímicas, galvanostáticas cíclicas, titulação intermitente galvanostática, voltametria cíclica 
Na metodologia de caracterização, particular atenção é dada a microscopia uma vez que o projeto trata de nanotubos produzidos com vários tipos de catalisadores, por diferentes métodos e com uma série de espécies químicas inseridas homogeneamente ou não. No contexto da caracterização eletroquímica o projeto utiliza as principais técnicas de estudo utilizadas em eletroquímica de estado sólido.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo com microscopias de alta-resolução de nanotubos de carbono-LNLS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Título do Projeto Científico /Scientific Project Title: 	
Preparação e caracterização de nanotubos de carbono para possível aplicação em baterias recarregáveis de íons lítio	
	
Código da Proposta de Pesquisa/ Research Proposal ID:	
TEM - 1785	
	
 1. Título da proposta de pesquisa / Research Proposal title:	
Caracterização de amostras de nanotubos e carbono preparadas pelo método de decomposição química de vapor (CVD).	
	
2. Proposta de Pesquisa / Research Proposal:	
Este trabalho visa a caracterização, pela técnica da HRTEM, de amostras de carbono preparadas em um reator tubular de CVD (chemical vapor deposition) utilizando-se catalisadores metálicos e sais de metais de transição, suportados em zeólitas e silício poroso. Estes materiais foram preparados utilizando-se misturas de gases como nitrogênio, argônio (gases de arraste), metano, etileno e acetileno (precursores), em temperaturas de aproximadamente 600 ? 800 ºC. Dispõe-se ainda de amostras submetidas a tratamentos de purificação, para eliminação das impurezas de carbono amorfo e a mistura catalisadora. 	
1. Título da proposta de pesquisa / Research Proposal title: Caracterização de amostras de nanotubos e carbono e materiais nanocompósitos para aplicação em baterias de lítio 2. Proposta de Pesquisa / Research Proposal: Este trabalho visa a caracterização, pela técnica da HRTEM, de amostras de carbono preparadas em um reator de arco elétrico em atmosfera de hélio, utilizando-se catalisadores metálicos e óxidos. Estas amostras são ricas em nanotubos de carbono e tem sido submetidas a diferentes tratamentos para eliminação das impurezas formadas durante o processo de preparação. Além destas amostras, pretende-se caracterizar diversas amostras de materias compósitos de nanotubos de carbono com óxidos ou ligas metálicas. Nestes materiais compósitos pretende-se observar o modo de agregação e/ou interação entre os diferentes componentes e suas propriedades estruturais (EDS, SAD).

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: NANOTECNOLOGIA DE CARBONO APLICADA AO DESENVOLVIMENTO DE SENSORES, CÉLULAS FOTOVOLTAICAS, PSEUDO-CAPACITORES E COMPÓSITOS POLIMÉRICOS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O presente projeto visa o estudo de nanotubos de carbono (NTC), sua preparação e sua aplicação para o desenvolvimento de diversos dispositivos nanotecnológicos: sensores para detecção de gases de interesse ambiental, pseudo-capacitores, células fotovoltaicas e termoplásticos condutores. Os nanotubos de carbono serão preparados por reator de arco em atmosfera de gás ou aquosa e por deposição química a vapor (CVD), utilizando catalisadores sobre substratos ou injetados por nebulização. Além dos métodos de produção, estaremos também investigando métodos de funcionalização química dos NTC, e a possibilidade de formação de monocamadas organizadas sobre metais pela técnica de Langmuir-Blodgett (orientação dos tubos). As amostras de NTC, funcionalizadas ou não, serão investigadas por uma série de técnicas estruturais (tais como espectroscopia Raman, espectroscopia de absorção no infravermelho, absorção de raios-X (XAS)) e por técnicas de microscopia de transmissão e de varredura eletrônica. No caso dos sensores serão preparados eletrodos utilizando técnicas de espalhamento mecânico (spin-coating, doctor blade) ou ainda Langmuir-Blodgett. Estaremos desenvolvendo também células fotovoltaicas orgânicas de heterojunção dispersa (blenda de um material receptor e um material doador de elétrons) utilizando NTC como transportadores de elétrons. Nesse caso estaremos investigando superfícies de Au/NTC funcionalizados e orientados também pela técnica de Langmuir-Blodgett. Pseudo-capacitores de NTC funcionalizados ou não serão montados e caracterizados por técnicas eletroquímicas em diferentes eletrólitos (KOH, H2SO4, eletrólitos de baterias de íons de Li e eventualmente em líquidos iônicos). Outra importante aplicação dos NTC a ser investigada é a sua adição em polímeros de interesse industrial visando a preparação de compósitos condutores, cujas propriedades deverão ser devidamente caracterizadas.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Rede de Nanotubos de Carbonto edital 29/05
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
IV) Eletrodos para dispositivos de armazenamento e conversão de energia
Objetivo: Desenvolvimento de eletrodos de nanotubos de carbono ou compósitos de carbono/nanotubo para células combustíveis e pseudo-capacitores. (Grupo de Ribeirão Preto)
Metas: 
1)	Sintetizar e estudar eletrodos de carbono crescidos sobre substratos de carbono por CVD visando aplicação dos mesmos em sistemas de armazenamento e conversão de energia: placas para células combustíveis e pseudo-capacitores de Li (liquido iônico);
2)	Desenvolver métodos de ancoragem de nanoparticulas metálicas com atividade catalítica para reações de interesse em células combustíveis; Desenvolver métodos de ancoragem de nanoparticulas óxidas com atividade capacitiva ou pseudo-capacitiva;
3)	Preparar eletrodos utilizando ligantes poliméricos;
4)	Estudar eletrodos de carbono em células combustíveis;
5)	Desenvolvimento de pseudo-capacitor em eletrólito liquido (protótipo);
6)	Estabelecer colaboração com.grupos de Raman dentro da Rede para caracterização dos nanotubos na forma de filmes para complementação dos estudos de morfologia e isotermas de adsorção.
7)	Estabelecer colaboração com grupos da Rede para o aperfeiçoamento de processos de crescimento já em andamento no grupo de Ribeirão Preto (principalmente por CVD)
8)	Estabelecer parcerias com grupos de pesquisa ou empresas para testes dos eletrodos desenvolvidos para células combustíveis
9)	Formar recursos humanos, divulgar resultados científicos e patentear resultados tecnológicos. 

Coordenador da Rede Marcos Pimenta- Parte acima corresponde a nossas principais responsabilidades dentro da rede.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Instituto de Nanotecnologia edital 01/2005 CNPq
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Instituição	Número de Participantes	Contribuição ao Projeto
DF/UFMG	
29	1. Síntese de nanotubos de carbono e fabricação de nanoestruturas semicondutoras, magnéticas e metálicas.
2. Desenvolvimento de sensores de gases à base de nanotubos de carbono
3. Investigação de propriedades de nanotubos de carbono e de nanoestruturas semicondutoras, magnéticas e metálicas utilizando técnicas experimentais ópticas, estruturais, magnéticas e eletrônicas 
4. Modelamento teórico de nanotubos de carbono e de nanoestruturas semicondutoras.
5. Estudo experimental de interação DNA-fármaco e de propriedades de células e suas funções por técnicas de pinça óptica e microscopia defocalizada.
DQ/UFMG	2	1.	Síntese e investigação de compósitos de polímeros e nanotubos de carbono.
2.	Desenvolvimento de um dispositivo supercapacitor com os compósitos desenvolvidos .
3.	Síntese de magnetos moleculares.
ICB/UFMG	3	1. Preparação e caracterização de lipossomas
2. Preparação de macrófagos e estudos de inflamação
Eng/UFMG	1	1. Desenvolvimento de um sistema de produção de nanofios por electrospinning
UFRJ	15	1. Modelamento teórico de nanotubos de carbono e de nanoestruturas semicondutoras, supercondutoras, magnéticas e de polímeros. 
2. Investigação experimental de nanoestruturas magnéticas e de magnetos moleculares 
3. Estudos experimentais em vários tipos de células utilizando pinças ópticas
4. Modelamento teórico da técnica de pinças ópticas 
Nanocore BiotecnologiaLtda.	2		1. Desenvolvimento e produção em escala piloto de biomoléculas e sistemas nanoparticulados
	2. P&D e produção de vacinas gênicas associados a micro e nanocarreadores.
	3. desenvolvimento de processos industriais de fabricação de nanoesferas e nanocápsulas
	4. estudos clínicos em humanos e animais de grande porte (bovinos).
IF/USP	3	1. Modelamento teórico de nanotubos de carbono e de nanofios semicondutores 
IQ/USP	1	1. Modificação química, dopagem e funcionalização de nanotubos de carbono
Med/USP-RP

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Nanotubes electrodes were studied like composite electrodes using a binder that is generally utilized in the anodes of Lithium ion. The nanotubes were synthetized when similar graphite rods with central holes packed with a catalyst were likewise pyrolised in a He atmosphere (with an initial pressure of 400 Torr, 120A). The catlyst was a mixture of Fe:Ni:Co powder (1:1:1 wt). The composite electrodes (thickness ~ 70mm) were prepared by spreading onto copper foil a mixture of active material (90% wt) with binder (polyvinyldene fluoride 10% wt) using a Doctor blade. The active material was the (RC) raw carbon (nanotubes + graphite + soot) or the (RCT) raw carbon submitted to ultrasuonic treatment in methanol + Soxhlet extraction in toluene + heat in atmosphere (450oC, 20min). X-ray diffraction and Raman showed that this treatment remove graphite and soot of raw carbon. Characterization electrochemical carried out using 1mol.L-1 LiClO4 or LiPF6 in EC-ethylene carbonate and DMC-dimethyl carbonate (1:1 wt). For the raw carbon composite electrode the profile of voltage versus specific capacity curve is similar to the graphite with low reversible specific capacity 133mAh.g-1 and the first discharge of electrode reached 253 mA.h.g-1 (EC/DMC + LiPF6). For the composite electrode prepared with raw carbon rich of nanotubes, the first discharge was 1152 mA.h.g-1 (EC/DMC + LiPF6) and 1203 mA.h.g-1 (EC/DMC + LiClO4), while the Creversible was 256 mA.h.g-1 (EC/DMC + LiClO4) and 410 mA.h.g-1 (EC/DMC + LiPF6). The chemical ant thermal treatment utilized here, appears adequate for improve the lithium intercalation capacity of the raw carbons produced in the arc-reactor. 

IV Brazilan Meeting and 33 rd IUVSTA Workshop on Diamond, Diamond-like, Nanotubes, Nitrides

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Lithium insertion in diamond by electrochemical method

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IV Brazilan Meeting and 33 rd IUVSTA Workshop on Diamond, Diamond-like, Nanotubes, Nitrides

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The insertion of lithium in the interstitial sites of diamond is reaction that could be used to induce the n-type doping. The lithium when is intercalated into a solid it generally transfers its 2s electron to unoccupied one-electron levels in the host. The Fermi level moves up with respect to the bands and depending on lithium concentration the rigid-band model is break-up. In this work we studied the lithium intercalation into boron-doped diamond electrodes grown on a cloth of graphite fibers by electrochemical method. Boron doped-diamond films were grown by hot-filament-assisted CVD technique at 1100 K from a 0.5% H2/CH4 mixture at a total pressure of 6.5 x 103 Pa. The electrochemical characterization of the electrodes was carried out by voltammetry cyclic and cronopotenciometry cyclic (charge/discharge curves). The electrolyte used was 1mol.L-1 of LiPF6 in a mixture of ethylene carbonate (EC), dimethyl carbonate (DMC) and diethyl carbonate (DEC) (1:1:1 wt). All experiments were carried out in Ar atmosphere (dry-box). The results show that the insertion of lithium Lix(BzC1-z)6 is reversible and presents specific capacity which depend on B-concentration. For limits of cut-off potential equal 3.0 e 0.01V versus Lithium we found a reversible specific capacity equal to 88mAh.g-1 (x ~ 0.23) for sample with ~1018 B-cm-3 and 43 mAh.g-1 (x ~ 0.11) for the sample with ~1021 B-cm-3. The voltage versus capacity presents hysteresis that increases with decreasing of Boron concentration. The discharge capacity (1st insertion) is major for the sample with minor Boron concentration (~1018 B-cm-3). The irreversible capacity fraction in the first cycle was 55% (~1021 B-cm-3) and 63 % (~1018 B-cm-3) indicating that the diamond with lower electronic conductivity provokes major decomposition of electrolyte during the first insertion of lithium.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: An anode for lithium insertion obtained from sugar cane bagasse

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IV Brazilan Meeting and 33 rd IUVSTA Workshop on Diamond, Diamond-like, Nanotubes, Nitrides

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Sugar cane bagasse is a highly fibrous, low-density material that is generated in the processing of sugar cane (ethanol and sugar). Part of this waste material has been used in Brazil to production of energy, while the other tons are disposed in the ambient. Pyrolysis of bagasse carried out under N2 atmosphere (420oC, 600oC, 800oC and 900oC plateaux temperature) was found appropriated for the preparation of a carbon that can be used as anode in the lithium ion cells [1,2]. The carbon obtained is amorphous and the X-ray diffraction reveals SiO2. Elemental analysis detected hydrogen and nitrogen fractions that decrease with increasing of the plateaux temperature. For electrochemical characterizations was prepared composites electrodes using the pyrolysed carbon (90%) and polyvinilidene fluoride (10%). The reversible specific capacity was major for the composite electrodes prepared with pyrolysed carbon at 420oC (BET area 121 m2.g-1). After 15 discharge/charge cycles (several weeks), the specific capacity was 310 mAh.g-1 (0.3mA.cm-2) in 1mol.L-1 LiPF6 dissolved in a mixture of EC-ethylene carbonate, DMC-dimethyl carbonate and DEC-diethyl carbonate (1:1:1 wt). The worst irreversible capacity 490oC was obtained for the electrode prepared with pyrolysed carbon at 800oC (BET area 223 m2.g-1). The structural order of the carbon obtained from bagasse appears like the principal player in the reversible capacity.
 
[1] S.M.Lala, Master Thesis at University of São Paulo, 2001.
[2] S.Passerini, J.M.Rosolen and B.Scrosati,

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Preparação de LiCoO2 para baterias de lítio iônico

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Um dos principais materiais utilizados como catodo nas baterias de íons de Lítio é o LiCoO2. Tal óxido é um composto semicondutor que é usado na produção de baterias de celulares de alta durabilidade e potência. Nestas baterias o material óxido é misturado na forma de pó com um polímero semicondutor e um aditivo de condutividade de um modo tal que se obtém no final um material compósito. A resposta deste material compósito depende muito do tamanho dos grãos e da estrutura cristalina do LiCoO2, parâmetros que são determinados pelo método de síntese. No presente trabalho foram estudadas duas rotas para produzir LiCoO2: um que usa Co metálico (com dimensão de grãos < 400 mesh) e LiOH e outro que utiliza LiOH e CoNO3. As principais técnicas usadas na caracterizacao foram difração de raios-X, FTIR, MEV e curvas de carga/descarga. Os resultados mostram que o método que utiliza nitrato de Co apresenta grãos com dimensão bem menores do que o método que usa Co metálico para uma mesma temperatura final de tratamento térmico. Ambos os métodos permitiram obter LiCoO2 com estrutura romboédrica (R-3m) bem ordenada com os íons de Li, Co ocupando os sítios 3a, 3b e o oxigênio 6c. Todavia, o tratamento térmico para obter-se este tipo de estrutura tem uma duração menor e uma temperatura de sinterização mais baixa para o método que usa o nitrato de cobalto. A resposta eletroquímica dos eletrodos preparados com os pós mostraram-se melhores para os grãos com menor dimensão.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Single-wall carbon nanotubes were produced with, either, a bimetallic or a mixture of three catalysts. Raman scattering and high resolution transmission electron microscopy were used as characterization tools. The mixture LiNi0.5Co0.5O2 leaded to a sample relatively free from impurities with long bundles, each containing a few tubes. A narrow distribution of diameters for the sample produced with this mixture was evidenced by Raman scattering experiences. The mean tube diameter was found to be smaller than those measured for the nanotubes obtained with the bimetallic catalysts, Fe/Ni and Ni/Co. Possible chiralities were calculated for the semiconductor nanotubes formed. Assignments of the Raman radial breathing mode frequencies to the calculated structures are presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Thin films of PbI2 produced by SPRAY PYROLYSIS

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Thin films of lead iodide (PbI2) were produced from aqueous solution using the method of spray pyrolysis. The samples were deposited on glass substrates at 200º. They could be used as radiation detectors in medical applications in the future. In this work, besides the fabrication technique, we also discuss the structural and optoelectronic properties of the original films and of those submitted to thermal treatment at 3500C for 3 hours.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Estudo da correlação entre as propriedades estruturais e difusionais no óxido LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Entre os materiais utilizados comercialmente na construção de baterias recarregáveis de íons lítio, estão os óxidos LiCoO2 e LiNiO2. Estes materiais apresentam no entanto alguns problemas em relação ao custo e propriedades estruturais e eletroquímicas. Na tentativa de otimizar as propriedades destes dois materiais, óxidos mistos do tipo LiCo1-yNiyO2 tem sido preparadas e caracterizadas. Neste contexto, foi preparado o óxido LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2, um material que tem sido amplamente estudado em nosso grupo de pesquisa. Este óxido LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2 apresenta uma estrutura hexagonal com grupo espacial R-3m; uma estrutura lamelar com os metais em coordenação octaédrica e um arranjo dos átomos no plano (111) em uma seqüência ? O ? Li ? O ? (Co, Ni) ? O ? Li ? O ? . Em trabalhos já publicados, demonstramos que os metais encontram-se em um estado de oxidação Ni2+ e Co3+, e que uma desintercalação de lítio neste material (LixCo0.5Ni0.5O2) provoca uma oxidação de Ni2+ para Ni3+, até aproximadamente x = 0.5, e posteriormente uma oxidação dos átomos de oxigênio de O2- para O-, permanecendo o Co praticamente inalterado.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Pesquisadores em todo o mundo buscam metodos alternativos que minimizem o tempo de deposição de filmes finos de materiais semicondutores considerados como bons candidato para aplicação na area medica. Como exmpelo, o iodeto de chumbo tem sido um dos materiais sugeridos como candidato na fabricação de detectores de raios-C para aplicações em radiografias digistais. Note que este funcionariam a temperatura ambiente. Este trabalho mostra a aplicação de um método alternativo de crescimento de filmes fions denominado spray pyrolysis. Mostra inda a análise das propriedades estruturais e eletronicas dos filmes fabricados. Froam obtidos filmes fions a partir de solução aquosa, depositados em diferentes temperaturas de substrato ( de 150 a 270C. Estes foram submetidos a tratamento termico a 350C durantes 3 horas em atmosfera ambiente e em atmosfera controlada (N2). Foram analisadas as variações no tamanho dos cristais (com base no pico principal- 001) e nas energias de ativação para transporte eletrico considerando-se diferentes temperaturas de deposição

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Structural Assessment Of The Electrochemical Performance Of Lixcoo2 Membrane Electrodes By X-Ray Diffraction And Absorption Refinements

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: LixCoO2 samples with different nominal load x were prepared submitting HT-LiCoO2 membrane electrodes to electrochemical polarisation, followed by agin in open circuit conditions. Care was take to obtain samples for both positive and negative overcharge beyond the canonical regime ( 0.6<x<1) of the LixCoO2 electrode. For 11 samples tin the range 0.37<x<1.43 Rietveld refinements of X-ray diffraction data were performed wiht Li ant 3a, Co at 3b and O at 6c in the space group R-3m as starting model. In the range 0.37 <x<1, results show a continuous variation of the ac unit cell andstructural parameters such as the lithium site occupancy and the Li-O and Co-O interatomic distances. For samples in the range 1<x<1.43, Li2CO3 was detected as a n impurity which might be due to decompostion of the electrolyte, and , if the negative overcharge was high enough, an abnormally high electron density at the 3a site indicates some Li--Co substituion. Results from Co-K edge X-ray absorption spectroscopy for the samples wiht x = 0.37, 0.89, 1 and 1.43 show a cleas shift of the absorption maximum with the oxidation state of Co and support the conclusions from Rietveled refinement. GNXAS refinement of EXAFS spectra for the samples wiht x =0.37 and 1 suggest that cation disordering may occur also for deep lithium deintercaltion (positive overcharege), a fact which was not detectable from diffraction data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Stress In Carbon Thin Films During Li Electrochemical Intercalation

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The mechanical deformation of thin films and membrane carbon electrodes during galvanostatic, charge-discharge cycles has been measured by a simple otpical techinique. We have considered the deformations of coke and of graphite membrane electrodes to be due to the varation s in the volume of grains and to the surface forces resulting from the electrochemical double-layer. For suche compositve electrodes the minimum stress can be asssociated with the potential of xero charge of electrode the electrode. The results show that the stress is due mainly to variations of volume in noporous electrodes, to surface forces, and to the presence fo passivating layer in very porous electrodes. The stress observed in the membrane electrodes after Li intercalation consist of an irreversible compressive tension and results in a permanent deformation of the electrodes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electrochemistry Of KC8 In Lithium-Containing Electrolytes And Its Use In Lithium Ion Cells

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The electrochemistry of KC8 in a lithium-containing ethylene carbonate-dimethycarbonate electrolyte has been studied. The results show that upon oxidation KC8 irreversibly releases potassium ions and that during the following cathodic cycle, the residual graphite intercalates lithium reversibly and with fast rate upo to a LiC6 composition. The results also shwo that a KC8 electrode can be used in lithium-ion cells in combination with partially lithiated or even with lithium=free cathodes. The maximum capacities (referred to the anode) that may be achieved are 372 and 279mAhg respectively.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: XAS And Electrochemical Characterization Of Lithium Intercalated V2o5 Xerogel

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The use of sol-gel processses in the preparation of cathode is of growing interest because of their ease and flexibility. The electrochemical properties, e.g. the rate of lithium intercalation, appear to depend on the morphology of thin-film vanadium oxide xerogels that can be changed by modifying the preparation. In this context, in order to extend the study to bulk materials, xerogel powder samples wiht surface areas in the range 2-5m2/g have been prepared from pure vanadium pentoxide hydrogels, or in the form of composites, from carbon powder added to hydrogels. The electrochemical properties have been correlated with the morphological and strucutural changes induced by the presence of carbon using X-ray and XAS spectroscopy.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Short-Range Order In Solid And Liquid Kbr Probed By Exafs

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Br K-edge EXAFS spectra of solid and liquid KBr have been performed and analysed using advanced techniques for data analysis (GNXAS). Structural results on solid KBr at room temperature and near melting are compared with molecular dynamics (MD) simulations and diffraction data. The first-neighbour distribution is found to be strongly asymmetric even at room temperature, as also shown by MD simulations . This confirms the existence of important anharmonic effects in solid KBr. MD simulations are in agreement with EXAFS data at room temperature. Fo r solid KBr near melting, anharmonic effects become very important. In comparation with MD calculations, the rise of the first-neighbour peak is found to be steeper, while the foot of the first-neighbour distribution is found to be slightly shifted toward longer distances. Experimental short-range partial pair distribuition functions gBrK and gBrBr are derived in liquid KBr for the first time. The first peak of the gBrK distribution is accurately determined and found to be in good agrreement with MD simulations, confirming a slight contraction of the most probable Br-K distance in the liquid phase. The first peak of the gBrBr distribution, measured with less accuracy, is found to be sharper and slightly shifted to longer distances, lowering the overlap with the first-neighbour K shell.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Radial Distribution Function In Solid And Liquid Kbr Probed By Exafs

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Accurate Exafs spectra of solid and molten KBr are analysed using the GNXAS multiple-scattering method. Short-range radial distribution functions derived by eXAFS are compared with results of molecular dynamics (MD) simulations. Important anharmonic effects are found in solid KBr, in agreement with MD calculations. Local structure of liquid KBr is measured and compared with MD results for the first time.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Raman Investigation On Li-Intercalated Amorphous Carbon Films

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Amorphous carbon films, deposited via radio frequency magnetron sputtering, have been electrochemically intercalated with lithium to study their possible application as anodes for rechargeable Li microbatteries. Various concentrations of intercalated lithium have been obtained, by using galvanostatic and potentiostatic methods. After preliminary examinations by optical microscopy and by optical absorptioon measurements, a comparative Raman spectroscopy characterization of the films has been performed with excitation wavelengths ranging from 676.4 to 457.9nm to follow resonance effects. A study is made on the Raman spectral shape and its excitation wavelenght dependence for the film samples with different Li concentrations. A moderate graphitization process of a-C films after intercalation results from this analysis. The Raman spectral changes induced by Li insertion do not reverse after further deintercalation cycles, and this fact is discussed in connection to the observed electrochemical reversibility of the a-C:Li electrodes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electrochemical Intercalated Mxc60 Thin Films In A Solid State Cell: Optical And Photoelectrochemical Characterization

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Solid-state electrochemical cells have been prepared with C60 vaccum-evaporated thin films, a Li or K source counter electrode and a polymer PEO-LIClO4 (PEO-KClO4) electrolyte. The electrochemical intercalation in C60 of Li (or K) ions has been performed under constant current conditions up to a formal stoichiometry of the fulleride film equal to Li12C60 (K5C60). A complete charge-transfer process from the intercalated alkali to the alkali-metal compound has been assumed. Several quasi-equilibrium potential plateaux were observed during intercalation, that we associate wiht the coexistence of phases with different intercalant concentration. The electrochemical intercalation process is irreversible to a large extent. Optical and photoelectrochemical spectroscopy of the fulleride films was done "in-situ"at different moments of the intercalation reaction by illuminating the film electrodes through the transparent and conducting glass substrates. The photoelectrochemical spectral response agrees well with the optical absorption spectra, both indicating a bandgap of 2.2 eV. The photoelectrochemical response shows a minium for x = 3 ( in the KxC60 compound) and a maximum at x =4 ( in both KxC60 and LixC60 compounds), in agreement wiht previous conductivity results. NIR diffuse reflectance spectra of the solid-state cell show absorption bands in the fulleride films at a wavelength of 1100 nm. A band-energy diagram has been proposed for the MxC60/PEO-MClO4/M electrochemical cell.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electronic Structure of the Transition metal ions in LiCoO2, LiNiO2 and LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the electronic structure of the transition metal ions in LiCoO2, LiNiO2 and LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2. The experimental technique used in the study was Co 2p and Ni 2p X-ray absorption spectroscopy. The experimental results were analyzed using atomic multiplet plus crystal field calculations. The Co ions in LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2 are in a trivalent Co+3 low-spoin state given by t2g as in LiCoO2. The Ni ions in LiCo0.5NI0.5O2 are in a divalent Ni+2 high-spin state given by t2g 6eg2 (3A2), as in LiNiO2. The missing charge at the Ni site is compensated by a less negative O ion; this means that the charge state in LiNiO2, for instance, is closer to Li+Ni+2O2!.5- than to the usually quoted LI+Ni+3O2. This is important for undestanding the oxidation-reduction processes upon Li deintercalation-reintercalation reactions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Tetrakis (N-methyl-4-pyridyl) Porphyrin copper into V2O5 Xerogel: Synthesis and Structural Characterization

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper reports on the intercalation of the cationic water-soluble tetrakis(N-methyl-4-pyridyl) porphyrin copper into V2O5 xerogel and the structural and spectroscopic characterization of the obtained products. The preparation procedure is carried out to preserve the anisotropic lamelar structure nature of the xerogel. The X-ray diffraction, FTIR, EPR and SEM data show the maintenance of the matrix framework during the intercalation, which is consistent with a topotatic reaction, and the formation of nucleation centers promoting the organization of polimeric chains. The results also indicate weak interaction between the host and guest species leading to the formation of an ordered organic-inorganic composite.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The mirage effect analysis of the electrochemical processes in nickel hydroxide electrodes

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work we have shwn that the mirage effect is a very useful tool in electrochemistry. Using this technique we showed, ina ccordance with other results that the electrochemical reactions describing the oxidation-reduction precesses of Ni(OH)2 electrodes in alkaline electrolytes must take into account the participation of cations from the solution.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The mirage effect: a sensitive probe for electrochemical cell calorimetry

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Measurements of the mirage deflection in an electrochemical cell, where Cu electrodeposition and the ferro/ferricyanate reaction occurred, were performed in the dark under a potential step and in ac conditions wiht the aim of detecting thermal phenomena due to Joule and Peltier effects at the interface. A mathematicla model based onthe diffusion of thermal and ionic waves into the electrolyte allowed simulation of mirage deflection in all cases. The experimental conditions under which the model is valid and the thermal effects can be separated from the ionic effects were discussed. Finally, the Peltier coefficient of the ferro/ferricyanate redox couple could also be measured using the ac technique.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The Mirage effect with a supporting electrolyte at constant mass transfer through the diffusion layer

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper we discuss the effect of a supporting electrolyte on mirage experiments in electrochemical cells and we report data showing the depedence of the mirage signal on the concentration of the supporting electrolyte. Concentration profiles for all species present in the eelctrolyte can be calculated exactly under specific requirements. The mirage signal is then calculated as a function of the ration of the concentration of the supporting and the electroactive electrolytes, and the results are compared with the experimental data. This model allows calculation of the optical parameters of the supporting electrolyte and not just those of the electroactive species.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Plasticized carbon electrodes of interest for lithium rocking chair batteries

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The electrochemical propperties of a carbon-coke electrode, fabricated in the form of a thin-film, flexible membrane by a procedure which involves the immobilization of carbon into a poly(vinyl chloride) PVC matrix, have been examined. The thermodynamics and the kinetics of the lithium insertion/deinsertion process in these LixC6 carbon-cok membrane electrodes have been investigated by voltage-compostion and galvanostatic curves, by cyclic voltammetry, and by impedance spectroscopy. The expectation is that the data obtained in this work may serve as a basis for the evaluation of the applicability of the carbon membrane as anode in rocking chair batteries of the most common liquid electrolyte type and, in prospective, of the polymer-electrolyte type.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Changes in the Electronic Structure of Chemically Deintercalated LiCoO2

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the changes in the electronic structure of LiCoO2 induced by Li deintercalation. The technique used in the study was Co 2p and O 1s X-ray absorption spectroscopy. The results were analyzed using atomic multiplet and band structure calculations. The Co 2p spectrum shows that the Co ions in LiCoO2 are in a trivalent Co3+ low-spin state. The Co 2p spectra of deintercalated LiCoO2 show only minor changes as a function of Li concentration; the absence of changes indicates that the Co ions remain mostly unaffected by Li deintercalation. In particular, the Co ions in deintercalated LiCoO2 are not oxidized to a tetravalent Co4+ state as usually assumed. On the other hand, the O 1s spectra of deintercalated LiCoO2 show an increase in the absorption intensity below threshold; this absorption increase implies that the O ions in LixCoO2 are reduced upon Li deintercalation. In conclusion, the charge state of the ions in deintercalated LixCoO2 is closer to Li+xCo3+[O2-/O-]2 than to the usually quoted Li+x[Co3+/Co4+]O2-2.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electronic structure of the transition metal ions in deintercalated and reintercalated LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the electronic structure of the transition metal ions in deintercalated and reintercalated LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2. The experimental technique used in the study was Co 2p and Ni 2p X-ray absorption spectroscopy. The shapes of the multiplet in the spectra are directly related to the ground state of the transition metal ions. The experimental results were analyzed using atomic multiplet plus crystal field calculations. The Co ions are in a trivalent Co3+ low-spin state in LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2 and remain mostly unaffected by Li deintercalation down to x = 0.20. On the other hand, the Ni ions are in a divalent Ni2+ high-spin state in LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2 and not in the usually quoted trivalent Ni3+ state. The Ni ions are partially oxidized to a trivalent Ni3+ state upon Li deintercalation down to x = 0.50. Further Li deintercalation, down to x = 0.20, does not result in further oxidation of the Ni ions. It is worth noting that the changes in the electronic structure of the Ni ions are reversible upon Li reintercalation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: XANES and EXAFS of chemically deintercalated LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the electronic and crystallographic structures of chemically deintercalated stoichiometric LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2. The experimental technique used in this study was X-ray absorption spectroscopy (both XANES and EXAFS). The results show that the electronic and crystallographic structures are similar to electrochemically deintercalated LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2. The electronic and structural similarity found here is in good agreement with previous XAS and XRD results. This means that the conclusions based on these studies could, in principle, be of use for electrochemically deintercalated LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Photoelectrochemical behavior of LiCoO2 membrane electrode

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the photoresponse of a membrane electrode of stoichiometric LiCoO2 used in ion-lithium batteries. The electrode LiCoO2 in contact with dimethyl carbonate, propylene carbonate and LiClO4 presents the behavior of a p-semiconductor/electrolyte junction. The deinsertion of lithium of the LiCoO2 suppresses the photoresponse at 3.9V versus lithium potential. The reappearance of the photoresponse after re-intercalation suggests that the alterations in the electronic structure of LixCoO2 electrode probed by the photoelectrochemical experiments during deinsertion are reversible until x = 0.5. The direct band gap energy of the LiCoO2 stoichiometric is 2.5eV before and after lithium reinsertion. The experiments showed also that a small photo-intercalation current is observed in this cathodic material.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Formation of Li2O in a chemically Li intercalated V2O5 xerogel

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the electronic structure of a chemically and electrochemicaly Li intercalated V2O5 xerogel. The technique used in the study was V 2p and O 1s X-ray absorption spectroscopy. The V ions in the as prepared V2O5 xerogel are mostly in a pentavalent V5+ state. The spectra show that the V ions are partially reduced to V4+ and V3+ states upon Li intercalation. The results also show that low Li intercalation (x < 1) affects mostly O 2p-V 3d mixed states, whereas for higher Li intercalation (x > 1) this mechanism saturates and leads to Li2O formation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Síntese de Nanotubos de Carbono de Parede Simples por Sublimação de Grafite em Atmosfera de Hélio

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Macroscopic samples of fullerene nanostructures are obtained in a modified arc furnace using the electric arc method with a Helium atmosphere at low pressures. High purity graphite rods are used as electrodes but, when drilled and the orifices filled with powders of transition metals (Fe, Co, Ni) acting as catalysts, the resulting particles are carbon nanostructures of the fullerene family, know as Single Wall Nanotubes (SWNTs). They have typical diameters of 1.4 nm, lengths up to tenths of microns and they are arranged together in bundles containing several SWNTs. Those samples are observed and analyzed using Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) and Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) techniques.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Gelatin-DMSO: a new approach to enhancement of the performance of pyrite electrode in the lithium battery

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Gelatin appears like a promissory additive to improve the reversible specific capacity of pyrite electrodes working at ambient temperature and liquid electrolyte. Galvanostatic discharge/charge cycles to 1.1 V indicated that gelatin can acts like a SEI or protective layer. The electrochemical study was carried out upon natural pyrite powder (FeS1.9) submitted or no to treatment with non-aqueous gelatin solution. Pyrite/gelatin/PEO/PVDF composite exhibited at 15th cycle after several weeks of operation a reversible capacity on the order of 275 mAh.g-1 (0.4 mA.cm-2) in EC:DMC:LiPF6.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the electrochemical response of a Li-intercalated V2O5 xerogel doped with Eu. We found that the electrochemical performance of the rare-earth doped xerogel is improved. This is attributed to bonding of the rare-earth ions to the residual H2O in the xerogel structure. The electronic structure of the original V2O5 xerogel is not drastically affected by the rare-earth doping.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electrochemical intercalation of lithium into boron doped into boron doped CVD diamond electrodes grown on carbon fiber cloths

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Boron-doped diamond electrodes grown on a cloth of graphite fibers have demonstrated as an innovative material electrode for lithium intercalation by electrochemical method. It was studied lithium electrochemical intercalation for samples with different levels of boron doping. Diamond films were grown by hot-filament-assisted CVD technique at 1100 K from a 0.5% H2/CH4 mixture at a total pressure of 6.5 x 103 Pa. Boron was obtained from a source of B2O3 dissolved in methanol. The electrochemical characterization was carried out by voltammetry cyclic and charge/discharge curves. The electrolyte used was 1mol.L-1 of LiPF6 in mixture of ethylene carbonate (EC), dimethyl carbonate (DMC) and diethyl carbonate (DEC) (1:1:1 wt). The reference and work electrode were metallic lithium and the cell was assembled a dry-box. The results show that the insertion of lithium Lix(BzC1-z)6 is reversible and presents specific capacity, which depend on B-concentration. For limits of cut-off potential of 3.0 e 0.01 V versus lithium we found a reversible specific capacity of 88 mAh.g-1 (x ~ 0.23) for sample with ~1018 B-cm-3 and 43 mAh.g-1 (x ~ 0.11) for sample with 1021 B-cm-3. The voltage versus capacity presents a hysteresis that increases with decreasing of boron concentration.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Improvement of the electrochemical performance of Li xV2O5 induced by Tb doping

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We have studied the electrochemical behavior of Tb0.11V2O5 electrodes in propylene carbonate and LiClO4. The techniques used in the study were cyclic voltammetry, discharge/charge polarization, FTIR and XRD. The Tb0.11V2O5 compound was prepared using the xerogel route and the composite electrodes were membranes prepared with PVDF-binder and carbon. The results show that the Tb doping improves the electrochemical performance of V2O5 due the bonding of the earth-rare ions and the residual H2O in the V2O5 structure. The capacity fading was reduced, the specific reversible capacity was 330 mA.g-1 (C/4, cut-off 3.7-2.0V) and the voltage presented a large plateaux at 2.5V for the Tb0.11V2O5 electrodes. The charge transfer between Li and Tb0.11V2O5 does not involve the oxi-reduction of the Tb3+ ions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis of LiCoO2 by metallo-organic decomposition-MOD

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We have studied the preparation of LiCoO2 powder using the MOD route in air atmosphere. Cobalt and lithium 2-ethylhexanoate were obtained from hydroxides and 2-ethylhexanoic acid. TG/DTA and XRD techniques were used to study the steps of formation of well-organized LiCoO2 (R-3m). The MOD route produced LiCoO2 (R-3m) at 700oC with specific surface area 1.7 m2.g-1 and size grain distribution d50 = 24 mm. The electrochemical response of MOD LiCoO2 powder was probed by cyclic voltammetry and discharge/charge cycles in composite electrode. The MOD method allows yields LiCoO2 agglomerate particles with size distribution and porosity that forward facile lithium diffusion in the composite electrode.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Study of oxygen influence in the production of single-wall carbon nanotubes obtained by arc-method using Ni and Y catalyst

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Single-wall carbon nanotubes were produced by arc method (He atmosphere) using Ni/Y2O3 and NiO/Y2O3 catalysts. The samples obtained by both the catalysts were collected in two regions of reactor: collar and walls zones. The raw material was also submitted to ultrasonic and filtration treatments using a surfactant aqueous solutions of sodium dodecyl sulphate. Raman scattering and transmission electron microscopies were used as characterisation tools. The distribution of carbon nanotube content depends on the zone from which samples are collected. In particular the highest carbon nanotube content is found in specimens coming from the collar zone when NiO/Y2O3 catalyst in employed. In fact, the presence of NiO in the catalyst seems to favour the carbon nanotube yield, despite of the consistent amount of the carbon impurities (amorphous carbon and graphite) still present in the raw material. Finally, the surfactant treatment effectively reduces the carbon impurities in the residue thus allowing for an appreciable separation of the carbon nanotube component.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: An step toward production of smaler diameter SWNTs

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Single-wall carbon nanotubes were characterized using Raman scattering and high-resolution transmission electron microscopy. The samples were obtained by arc discharge with the catalysts, Fe/Ni and Ni/Co and a LiNi0.5Co0.5O2 pseudo-ternary compound. The compound leaded to a sample relatively free from impurities with long bundles, each containing a few tubes. A narrow distribution of diameters for the sample produced with this catalyst was evidenced by Raman scattering experiences. The mean tube diameter in this case was found to be smaller than those measured for the nanotubes obtained with the bimetallic catalysts. Possible chiralities were calculated for the semiconductor nanotubes formed. Assignments of the Raman radial breathing mode frequencies to the calculated structures are presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: LiCoO2 Submicron Particles obtained from Micro-precipitation in Molten Stearic Acid

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract
The present work reports a novel emulsion method applied to preparation of lithium cobalt oxide based in the micro-precipitation of lithium and cobalt salts in molten stearic acid. The precursors of oxide investigated consist of micro-aggregated powder of CoOOH and CH3(CH2)16COOLi whose formation depends on concentration of stearic acid used in the synthesis. The micro-aggregated of CoOOH and CH3(CH2)16COOLi when calcined at 800 oC allowed yield well crystalline submicrons particles of LiCoO2 (R-3m) with a very uniform shape (quasi-hexagonal pellets), a very narrow grain size distribution (d10 = 0.31 mm, d50 = 3.14 mm, d90 = 6.30 mm) and high specific surface area (7.4 m2.g-1). The long life reversible specific capacity of the mp-LiCoO2 composite electrode studied here was 110 mA.h.g-1 for initial deinsertion 165 mAh. g-1 .

Keywords: Li-ion battery, oxides, emulsion

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Fabrication and characterization of thin films of PbI2 for medical imaging. Journal of Non-Crystalline Solids.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Thin films of lead iodide (PbI2) are promising candidates for applications in X-ray digital medical imaging. In this work we present a new methodology used for the deposition of thin films of PbI2: the spray pyrolysis technique. We investigate the structural properties of the films using X-ray diffraction and Raman Scattering experiments. The electronic properties of the obtained films are investigated using dark current versus voltage at room temperature and also using dark current as a function of temperature for a fixed voltage. Post-deposition thermal annealing is also used for induced crystal growth, where the influence of a controlled N2 or ambient atmosphere are compared.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: SWTN prepared by the arc discharge method were oxidized using nitric acid. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Single-wall carbon nanotubes were synthesised by arc method (He atmosphere) using various catalysts: Pt/WO3, Ni/Co and Ni/Co/Fe, Ni/Y2O3 and NiO/Y2O3. The samples were collected in two regions of reactor: collar and walls zones. The presence of oxygen in catalyst decreases the carbon impurities (amorphous carbon and graphite). Raman scattering and transmission electron microscopy were used as characterisation tools. Different carbon nanotube (CNT) yields have been found for the different catalysts: almost zero or very poor yield for Pt/WO3 and ternary Ni/Co/Fe metal catalysts, better and promising results for Ni/Co catalyst, especially after treatment with nitric acid, and for metal-oxide and oxide-oxide catalysts based on Ni/Y2O3 and NiO/Y2O3.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The role of structural and electronic alterations on the lithium diffusion in LixCo0.5Ni0.5O2

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The mechanisms of lithium diffusion in LixCo0.5Ni0.5O2 were investigated using the galvanostatic intermittent titration technique (GITT). Membrane electrodes were employed in this study, prepared with poly (vinylidene fluoride) and carbon black. The measured Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) area of LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2 powder was combined with the GITT data to extract the lithium chemical diffusion coefficient DLi+, the lithium self-diffusion coefficient DLi+ and the thermodynamic factor F as a function of Li concentration x. All three parameters vary nonmonotonicaly with x. A mininum in DLi+ and DLi+ at x = 0.5 along with structure changes suggest the formation of a lithium superlattice at that concentration. The reduction in F with lithium extraction (decreasing x) can be associated with the appearance of metallic character in LixCo0.5Ni0.5O2. The behavior of DLi+ is complex; but eventually, for x < 0.32, it undergoes a continuous decrease due to the metallic character. We attribute the limitation of the specific reversible capacity of LixCo0.5Ni0.5O2 in a Li-ion battery to this decrease in DLi+ and to elevated electrode voltages. The Li transport in LixCo0.5Ni0.5O2 is analyzed taking into account the variations of the cell parameters and the oxidation states of the Ni, Co and O ions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Investigations of Natural Pyrite in solvent-free polymer electrolyte, lithium metal batteries

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The reaction of natural pyrite and lithium was investigated in solvent-free, polymer electrolytes at medium temperature (90°C). In such a system the full capacity of pyrite is accessed in the first discharge-charge cycle, however, the system is affected by a substantial capacity fading especially in low rate discharges. The capacity fading observed is attributed to the irreversible reaction of the sulfur formed at the end of charge step and the polymer in the electrolyte. The investigation showed that the irreversible process occurring at 1.3V is not the cause of the capacity fading but it is resulting from the reduction of the above mentioned oxidation products.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We report the synthesis of a mixture of single-walled (SWNTs) and multi-walled carbon nanotubes (MWNTs) through arc discharge in H3VO4 aqueous solution using pure graphite electrodes. AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Prop. Óticas e Espectrosc. da Mat. Condens; Outras Inter. da Mat. com Rad. e Part.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The phonon properties of the lithium transition metal phosphates LiMPO4 (M = Ni, Co, Fe) with the
olivine structure were studied using a computational simulation. The calculation employs a normal
coordinate analysis based on the Wilson?s FG matrix method. The method applied to LiNiPO4 allowed
for the fitting of a set of stretching force constants and angle bond strengths that resulted in Raman
wavenumbers comparing with experiments within a 5% average deviation. This set was assumed fixed
for the isostructural Co-containing and Fe-containing compounds, as a first approximation. The calculated
LiCoPO4 Raman wavenumbers also compared well with experimental values (average deviation 9%).
Using this procedure, the 36 Raman wavenumbers of LiFePO4 were predicted and assigned to vibrational
motions and symmetry species of the crystal group. LiFePO4 unpolarized Raman data agree very well with
the predicted values.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Raman spectra, x-ray diffraction and infrared absorption of a series of LixCo0.9Ga0.1O2-HT oxides were obtained for 0.3 < x< 1. The Raman spectra of the realted ocmpounds LiCo0.9Ga0.1O2-LT, Ga2O3, Li2CO3 and Co3O4, were also obtained. The Raman scattering for the lithium deintercalted materials indicate that laser irradiation induces the formation of an impurity-phase that increases when the state of delithiation increases. The formation of such new phase was traced by the appearance of features in th in the Raman spectrum in excess of the bands predicted by the group factor analysis. The impurity-phase was identified as the Co3O4 cubi spinel structure by comparison of its Raman spectrum with spectra for LixCo0.9Ga0.1O2-HT. Infrared absorption and x-ray diffraction spectra shows no trace of Co3O4. Thsi fact leads to the conclusion that Co3O4 is generated just in small areas subjected to intense light irradiation, such as the laser focus spots in micro-Raman experiments (very low power 10^4W/cm2)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Structural properties of carbon felts (CF) produced from fibers of organic polymers such as polyacrylonitrile are presented as substrates for growing boron-doped diamond films. Diamond/CF electrodes take a particular importance for electrochemical study by presenting a large surface area increase that turns them appropriated to use as porous electrode for different electrochemical applications. The purpose of this study is to analyze the influence of heat treatment temperature (HTT) on CF properties by Raman spectroscopy and x-ray diffraction (XRD) measurements. Also, these structural changes are correlated with diamond film properties and its electrochemical response. Carbon felts substrate were produced in the temperature range of 1300 to 2300 K and presented a sensitive increase in their conductivity that are correlated with cyclic voltammetry measurements in ferri-ferrocyanide system for diamond/CF electrodes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electronic structure of chemically deintercalated LiCo0.9Ga0.1O2

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Physical Review B - Condensed Matter and Materials Physics

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the changes in the electronic structure of LiCoO2 induced by 10% Ga sub-stitution. The technique used in the study was Co 2p and O 1s X-ray absorption spectroscopy. The spectra were analyzed using atomic multiplet and band structure calculations. The Co 2p spectra show that the Co ions in LiCoO2 are in a trivalent Co3+ low-spin state, and that the electronic structure of the Co ions is not greatly affected by 10% Ga substitution. The Co ions remain in the trivalent Co3+ low-spin state in chemically deintercalated LixCo0.9Ga0.1O2.This shows that the Co ions in deintercalated LixCo0.9Ga0.1O2 are not oxidized to a tetravalent Co4+ state. The O 1s spectra are dominated by transitions to mixed O 2p - Co 3d states at threshold. The transitions to O 2p - Ga 4sp states appears well above threshold due to the larger hybridi-zation. The O 1s spectra of deintercalated LixCo0.9Ga0.1O2 show an increase in the absorption intensity at threshold. The increased O 1s absorption intensity indicates that the O ions are oxi-dized in deintercalated LixCo0.9Ga0.1O2. The results and conclusions obtained for deintercalated LixCo0.9Ga0.1O2 are similar to those for LixCoO2; this shows that the Ga substitution does not affect significantly the charge transfer mechanism in LixCoO2.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Impurity states in the band gap of LiFePO4 doped with Ti, Al and Cu

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We studied the changes in the electronic structure of LiFePO4 induced by Ti, Al and Cu doping. The technique used in the study was Fe 2p and O 1s X-ray absorption (XAS) spectroscopy. The XAS spectra were analyzed using atomic multiplet and band structure calculations. The Fe 2p XAS spectra show that the Fe ions in LiFePO4 are in a divalent Fe2+ high-spin state, and that the Fe ions remain in this Fe2+ state in the Ti, Al and Cu doped materials. The O 1s XAS spectra present relatively weak transitions to mixed O 2p - Fe 3d states at threshold (the transitions to O 2p - P 3sp states appears at higher energies due to the larger hybridization). The O 1s XAS spectra of the doped materials show additional absorption intensity just below threshold. These fea-tures correspond to transitions to doped states in the band gap of the LiFePO4 compound.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Alternative supports for the preparation of catalysts for low temperature fuel cells: the Use of Carbon Nanotubes

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Noble metal catalysts in the form of nanoparticles supported on high surface area carbon exhibit characteristics which depend strongly on the nature of the support. This work present results with noble metal catalysts supported on carbon nanotubso (MWNT and SWNT) and also on Vulcan XC_72, for proton exchange membrane fuel cells (PEMFC) fed with hydrogen contaminated with CO and also for the direct methanol fuel cell (DMFC). A high performance was achieved with PtRu deposited on nanotubes for H2+ 100 ppm CO, although it was similar to that presented by PtRu on Vulcan XC 72 with an overpotential of 100 mV at 1A.cm-2. Results for the DMFC showed power densities exceding 100mW cm-2 at 90C and 0.3 MPa and activity of the anodes followed the sequence: PtRu/MWNT > PtRu/Vulcan XC-72 > Pt Ru/SWNT. The electrocatalysts were preparaed with the same method, namely impregnation of the carbon with the precursors in ethanol and reduction under a hydrogen atmosphere. The role of Ni, Fe and other contaminatns contained in the nanotubes is discussed

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electrochemical Insertion of lithium into doped diamond grown on carbon felts substrates

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper summarizes the preliminary results of lithium electrochemical intercalation into diamond films grown on no woven of carbon fibers (felt) substrates. The results show that for limits of cut-off potential of 3.2 e 0.01 V versus lithium we found a specific capacity of 690 mAh.g-1 (x ~ 1.86) during the first insertion for sample with ~1021 B-cm-3, while the sample with 1018 part.cm3 reaches 370 mAh.g-1 (x ~ 0.99), where x is the nominal lithium concentration Lix(BzC1-z)6. The fraction of irreversible capacity in the first cycle was 53% for sample with 1021 part.cm-3 and 19 % for samples with 1018 part.cm-3.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The negative and positive structural effects of Ga doping in the electrochemical performance of LiCoO2

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The electrochemical performance of LiGayCo1-yO2 electrodes, y = 0.005 and 0.1, was studied. The charge/discharge curves in galvanostatic condition were obtained for a series of voltages ranging from 4.35 V to 4.7 V. The samples were previously characterized using X-ray diffraction (XRD), Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR), X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS) and conductivity measurements. Comparison of data for LiGayCo1-yO2 and the pristine oxide LiCoO2 is provided. Ga doping at 0.5% in mole in mole reduces drastically the capacity fading of the electrode when charge at 4.35V or 4.5V, while Ga doping at 10% in mole damage the electrochemical answer of Ga doped oxide same for a cut-off limit at 4.35V. This positive and negative effects was attributed both to changes in the electronic conductivity and local structure of the LiCoO2 provoked by substitution of Co for Ga as well as cationic disorder. For y = 0.005 occurs a slight distortion in the local structure of the LiCoO2 and formation of states in the band gap that increase its electronic conductivity, which explain the observed electrochemical improvement in the LiGayCo1-yO2. In opposition, for y = 0.1 occurs a hybridization with oxygen, which opens the band gap of the LiCoO2 making the LiGayCo1-yO2 an insulator and a cationic disorder material resulting in a poor electrochemical performance. Finally, XAS results show that Ga doping does not change also the mechanisms of charge transfer of LiCoO2 where the oxygen is reduced during lithium extraction.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Spectroscopy studies of LiFePO4 and LiM0.03Fe0.07PO4 (M =Cr, Cu, Al, Ti)
