INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Mossbauer and Raman measurmentes for LixFePO4 and LixM0.03Fe0.97PO4, M = Cr, Cu, Al, ti were performed. The results for the Li0.11FePO4 oxide require an unknown additional contribution, besides the high spin Fe2+ and hign spin Fe3+, for Mossbauer profile to be properly accounted for. The corresponding Raman scattering suggests a two-phase material and probably an additional disordeed structure present in small quantity. Using this information the new Mossbauer contribution was tracked to the disordered pahse revealed through Raman scattering. In addittion, the observation of a high amount of Fe2+ sites for the low lithium content LixM0.03Fe0.97PO4 oxides is analyzed on the basis of the electronic charge configuration of Li-lacking octahedral units to suffer small changes upon lithium extraction.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Li-inserted carbon nanotube Raman Scattering

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The possibility of inserting lithium into single wall carbon nanotube bundles during the growth process is analyzed in this work by using the Raman technique as probe. The nanotubes were prepared by the arc discharge method by using catalysts prepared by mixing compounds containing lithium and as their counterpart, a similar mixture without this alkali-metal. The two pair of samples studied in this work were obtained with the following catalysts: (i) Li2CO3/NiO/CoO and NiO/CoO; or (ii) LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2 and Ni/Co. Raman spectra reveal that the tangential bands profiles of the samples prepared with the catalyst containing lithium is considerably modified in both cases. In the case of the carbon nanotubes obtained using the LiCo0.5Ni0.5O2 catalyst a down shift and severe broadening are observed in addition. Comparison of our results with those published previously for alkali-metals doped single wall carbon nanotubes we were able to conclude that lithium incorporation, actually, occurs during the growth process. © 2002 Elsevier Science. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Correlation between chemical vapor deposited diamond and carbon fibers substrates

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Diamond film formation has been studied on carbon felts (CF) substrates produced from polyacrylonitrile precursor, at different heat treatment temperatures (HTT). CF structural properties knowledge and control have demonstrated to be very important for growing boron-doped diamond films on such substrates. During the deposition process, fiber etching and diamond nucleation occur simultaneously and compete kinetically. In addition, these processes may also be affected by the HTT of the carbon fiber precursor. An explanation is proposed to understand the diamond nucleation on CF structure. Raman spectroscopy has indicated good quality diamond with low amount of graphitic phase, mainly for diamond films grown on CF obtained at 2000ºC HTT.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electron field emission from composite electrodes of carbon nanotubes-boron doped diamond and carbon felts

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The electron field emission of carbon nanotube/boron doped diamond/carbon felt electrodes (CNT/BDD/Felt) have been investigated. The composite electrode was first prepared with the growth of boron doped diamond (BDD) on carbon felt and the subsequent growth of carbon nanotubes (CNT) by chemical decomposition of methanol. The composite electrodes were characterised using Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) and Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM). For the CNT/BDD/Felt samples the electron field emission was observed at macroscopic fields as low as 1.1 V. m-1. The emission current versus time plot shows great potential of this novel cathode for future robust field emission devices.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Carbon fibers with cup-stacked-type structure: an advantageous support for Pt-Ru catalyst in methanol oxidation

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Carbon fibers with dangling bonds lined up in an orderly way on the wall of the carbon tube and with an average tube diameter of about 25 nm were studied as support for Pt-Ru nanoparticles. These nanoparticles were prepared using a nonionic water-in-oil microemulsion (w/o) formed by polyethylenglycol-dodecylether, n-heptane, and water. To evaluate the electrochemical performance of this novel catalyst, Pt-Ru nanoparticles supported on carbon Vulcan XC were also prepared by the microemulsion method for comparison. Transmission electron microscopy, X¡Vray diffraction, energy dispersive X-ray analysis, and nitrogen adsorption were used to investigate the carbon-supported Pt-Ru catalysts. The microemulsion method furnished Pt50-Ru50 particles with average particle sizes of 4.0 ?b 0.8 nm, for both carbon supports. The electrocatalytic activity of the supported alloys in methanol oxidation was investigated by cyclic voltammetry and chronoamperometry. Results reveal that the catalytic activity is enhanced by a factor of two when the carbon nanofibers are used as support for the Pt-Ru nanoparticles. The electronic conductivity of the carbon fibers and dangling bonds seem to be the factors responsible for the excellent performance exhibited by the electrodes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electron field emission of carbon nanotubos on felt substrate

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) synthesized directly onto carbon felt have been investigated as electron field emission electrodes. This CNT/felt composite was prepared using the decomposition of methanol on metal catalyst supported on carbon felt. High resolution transmission electron microscopy and scanning electron microscopy were used to characterize the microstructure of the films. Electron field emission was observed at macroscopic field as low as 0.45 V. m-1, which is one of the lowest reported threshold fields for emission and was controlled by the CNT assembled on the felt. In addition, the emission current was found to be very stable with time, which is a good indicator as to the potential for the development of novel large area field emission devices.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A multi-step treatment to effective purification of single-walled carbon nanotubes

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: An efficient procedure for the purification of single-walled carbon nanotubos (SWCNTs) based on chemical treatment and physical separation is proposed and studied step-by-step by high-resolution transmission electron microscopy, thermogravimetric analyses, and nitrogen adsorption techniques. Impure raw samples prepared by the arc-discharge method containing SWCNTs, amorphous carbon, graphitic particles, carbon shells, metallic catalysts, and fullerenes were employed in this study. The procedure reported herein was used to remove each impurity of the sample in a step-by-step way. Gas-phase oxidation and the popular oxidation by heating in nitric acid were avoided to minimize damages to structure of the SWCNTs and to keep eventual chemical modifications of sample to a minimum. This new procedure is efficient and appropriate for the obtention of highly pure SWCNTs with minimal damage to the walls and minimal modification in the length of the tubes. The amount of each kind of impurity present in the raw material yielded in an arc-reactor was quantitatively estimated. Results of specific surface area and t-plots are also discussed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Raman and Fourier transform infrared measurements for LixM0:03Fe0:97PO4, M =
Cr, Cu, Al, Ti were performed. The spectra for delithiated samples to a low content
of lithium extraction are practically the same as those of LiFePO4. For a high
content of lithium extraction, the spectra repeat that of FePO4. In the case of the
Li0:11FePO4 oxide the spectra can not be reproduced just by the superposition of
the end member pro¯les. An additional broad band contribution is found in both
Raman and infrared spectra probably due to a disordered structure present in the
mixture. This suggests that the well accepted two{phase model for the delithiation
process in LiFePO4 is incorrect. The model should be revised to include the new
phase as detected here for a particular level of lithium extraction close to that of
complete oxidation of the Fe2+ ions to Fe3+.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A COMPARATIVE STUDY OF ALCOHOLS AND KETONES AS CARBON PRECURSOR IN MULTI-WALLED CARBON NANOTUBE GROWTH

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A comparative study of multi-walled carbon nanotube (MWCNT) growth from methanal, acetone, ethanol, 2-butanone,and 2-propanol was carried out aiming at detecting the role of the carbon source on the catalytic sites. Growth was accomplished under atmospheric pressure and at 600oC. The catalyst consisted of mixture of the Mn, Co salts chemically dispersed on a zeolite substrate. The samples were characterized using high-resolution transmission electron microscopy, scanning electron microscopy, Raman spectroscopy, and thermal analysis. The samples characteristics depend on the kind of solvent employed in the growth and they are discussed on basis of organic chemistry principles. The role of oCH3 and oOH radicals in MWCNT growth is discussed. Acetone was found as the best solvent to preparation of MWCNT.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Carbon nanotube/felt electrode without polymer binder

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Carbon nanotubes (CNT) kind of cup-stacked and bamboo synthesized directly onto carbon felt were investigated as electrode for lithium energy storage. The CNT/felt composite electrode was prepared using catalytic chemical vapor decomposition chemical on carbon felt. Scanning electron microscopy was used to characterize the microstructure of the electrodes. Electrochemical characterization of CNT/felt submitted or not to acid treatment to extraction of catalytic particles used in the CNT growth were carried out using 1 mol.L-1 LiPF6 in mixtures of ethylene carbonate, dimethyl carbonate, diethyl carbonate and propylene carbonate. Cylindrical CNT/felt electrodes with a diameter of the 7 mm, and with a thickness of about 1 mm were able to provide a capacitor with 5.5F.g-1 submitted to discharge/charge current of the 2.5A.g-1 for potential window between 0-3V. The reversible capacity of CNT/felt to charge/discharge current of about 1.3 A.g-1 was 100mAh.g-1 (0-4V versus lithium potential). These values were calculated using the total mass of electrode.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In this work we present the structural properties and stoichiometry analysis of thin films of lead iodide (PbI2).
This material is a very promising semiconductor material for the development of X-ray detectors in digital
medical imaging. An alternative deposition method called Spray Pyrolysis was used. We discuss the main
advantages and limitations of the deposition process comparing three different starting material powders. Extra
iodine atmosphere during deposition and the effect of post-deposition thermal treatment is also discussed. The
structural properties were studied by X-ray diffraction, Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM), Scanning Electronic
Microscopy (SEM) and stoichiometry analysis were performed using Energy Dispersive Spectroscopy (EDS).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Nanocrystalline diamond /carbon felt as a novel composite for electrochemical storage energy in capacitor

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this study, a novel electrode material, nanocrystalline diamond (NCD) grown on carbon fibers substrate (CF), has been developed for electric double-layer capacitor. CF substrates have been produced from fibers of organic polymers such as Polyacrylonitrile (PAN). Carbon fibers were treated at temperatures of 1300 and 2300 K by using the temperature steps of 60 K/h in a nitrogen atmosphere up to 1300 K and for more 4 h up to 2300 K. NCD films were grown from Ar/H2/CH4 mixtures on hot-filament chemical vapor (HFCVD) deposition reactor. Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) images of NCD have shown faceted diamond grains for both substrates. However, diamond film on CF-2300 presents a larger grain, characteristic of a higher film rate. This behavior is attributed to the microstructural changes promoted by the heat treatment temperature on CF substrate. The highest growth rate observed in sample NCD/CF-2300 is due to its graphite organization to be more favorable to diamond growth. Raman spectra are characteristic of NCD films and confirm the existence of sp2-bonded carbon in grain boundaries due to significant reduction of grain size. The spectra show a band centered at 1331 cm-1 (diamond) and other at 1345 cm-1 (D band). Two shoulders at 1150 and 1490 cm-1 also appears and are assigned to transpolyacetylene segments at grain boundaries of NCD surfaces. Electrochemical measurements were performed in a three-electrode arrangement, including a working electrode (NCD/CF), a platinum counter electrode and a Ag/AgCl reference electrode. Capacitor tests were carried out by cyclic voltammetry using 0.5 M sulfuric acid. The NCD/CF exhibited promising properties as electrode material in electrochemical double layer capacitor.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Li-insertion into carbon nanotubes: experiment and theory

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Lithium insertion during the arc discharge growth process is investigated by using resonance Raman spectroscopy combined with ab initio calculations. The measurements were performed in two single-wall carbon nanotubes, one prepared employing a lithium-contained catalyst and the lacking lithium counterpart. The analysis of the radial breathing modes performed with the help of Kataura plots allowed to assign all RBM lines to semiconducting tubes except for one, the lowest wave number positioned line in the Li-catalyst prepared sample. The line could be assigned exclusively to a metallic tube. The appearance of a metallic tube when only semiconducting tubes were expected leads us to perform electronic properties calculations. The results show that this effect can be tracked to the charge transfer occurring from lithium atoms inserted into the bundles. The transfer occurs preferentially to tubes of greater diameters and is limited to a Li insertion rate of Li6C68. The work demonstrates the possibility of Li-insertion during the growth process.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: RF Response of Single-Walled Carbon Nanotubes

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present for the first time an in-depth study of the RF response of a single-walled carbon nanotube (SWCNT) rope. Our novel electrode design, based on a tapered coplanar approach allows for single tube measurements well into the GHz regime minimizing substrate related parasitics. From the analysis of the S-parameters, the ac transport mechanism in the range 30kHz to 6GHz is established. This work is an essential prerequisite for the fabrication of high-speed devices based on SWCNTs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Impedance Characteristics of the diamond/carbon fiber electrodes for electrical double-layer capacitor (in press)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The electrochemical performance of carbon fibers (CF) and boron doped diamond growth on carbon fiber substrate (BDD/CF) was studied. The electrochemical responses were evaluated for their application as electrical double-layer capacitors from cyclic voltammetry and impedance measurements. CF substrates were obtained from polyacrylonitrile precursor heat treated at two different temperatures of 1000 and 2000 °C to produce the desirable carbon graphitization index. These three-dimensional CF structures allowed the high incorporation of diamond films compared to other carbon substrates like glass carbon and HOPG. This behavior showed a strong dependence with the CF graphitization temperatures. The results from cyclic voltammetry revealed that the composite electrode, formed by BDD film grown on CF-2000 depicted a typical capacitor behavior with the best rectangular shape, compared to those electrodes of CF or of BDD/CF-1000. The BDD/CF-2000 electrode also presented the lowest impedance. This performance was attributed to the differences among morphology roughness, film crystallinity and samples conductivity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Composite electrode of carbon nanotubes and vitreous carbon for electron field emission

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work, the electron field emission behaviour of electrodes formed by carbon nanotubes (CNTs) grown onto monolithic vitreous carbon (VCarbon) substrates with micro-cavities is presented. Scanning electron microscopy was used to characterize the microstructure of the films. Tungsten probes, stainless steel sphere, and phosphor electrodes were employed in the electron field emission study. The carbon nanotube/vitreous carbon (CNT/Vcarbon) composite represents a route to inexpensive excellent large area electron emission cathodes with fields as low as 2.1 V m-1 In preliminary lifetime tests for a period of about 24 hours at an emission current of about 4 mA cm-2 there is an onset degradation of the emission current of about 28%, which then stabilises. Electron emission images of the composites show the cavity of the samples act as separate emission sites and predominantly control the emission process. The emission of CNTs/Vcarbon was found to be stable for several hours.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electrochemical evidence of strong electronic interaction of PtRu on carbon nanotubes with high density of defects

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We show that carbon nanotubes (CNTs) with high density of defects can present a strong electronic interaction with nanoparticles of Pt-Ru with average particle size of 3.5 ± 0.8 nm. Depending on the Pt-Ru loading on the CNTs, CO and methanol oxidation reactions suggest there is a charge transfer between Pt-Ru that in turn provokes a decrease in the electronic interaction taking place between Ru and Pt in the PtRu alloy. The CO stripping potentials were observed at about 0.65 V and 0.5V for Pt-Ru/CNTs electrodes with Pt-Ru loadings of 10 and 20, and 30 wt %, respectively.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Lithium storage into carbonaceous materials obtained from sugarcane bagasse

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of the Brazilian Chemical Society (Impresso)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Carbonaceous materials with different structures are prepared by carbonization of sugarcane bagasse. Depending on carbonization conditions, it is possible to obtain soot rich in flakes or in honeycomb-shaped micrometric particles, whose concentration has large influence on lithium storage into electrodes. The soot rich in honeycomb-shaped particles provides the best electrochemical performance, with a reversible specific capacity of 310 mAh.g-1. The results suggest that the sugarcane bagasse can be potentially used in the design of anodic materials for lithium ion batteries.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TEXTO.TITULO-DO-TEXTO: Baterias de litio causam menor impacto ambiental

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TEXTO.TITULO-DO-JORNAL-OU-REVISTA: Jornal da Tarde e Agencia de Notícias USP

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ROSOLEN, J. M.;Rosolen, José M.;Rosolen, M.;Rosolen, José Maurício;Rosolen, J. Maurício;ROSOLEN, JOSE MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, J. MAURICIO;ROSOLEN, JOSÉ;ROSOLEN, J.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Um grupo de pesquisadores da USP de Ribeirão Preto está desenvolvendo baterias recarregáveis de íons de lítio, que causam menor impacto ambiental e alcançam maior voltagem do que as baterias convencionais, com custo de produção relativamente baixo. "A grande vantagem é que essa bateria pode ser produzida com diversos materiais. Usando diferentes eletrodos (condutores de elétrons e íons), produz-se baterias com voltagens, potências e toxicidades diferentes", explica Maurício Rosolen, professor responsável pelo grupo que pesquisa essas baterias, no Departamento de Química da Faculdade de Filosofia, Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto (FFCLRP). "Basta usar materiais menos tóxicos para produzir baterias mais 'verdes' e com melhor performance energética, enquanto as baterias convencionais só podem ser fabricadas usando os mesmos materiais, obtendo sempre os mesmos resultados, dando menos alternativas de mudanças e melhorias aos fabricantes".As baterias atualmente mais comercializadas no país têm constituintes tóxicos e cancerígenos, que prejudicam o meio ambiente quando vazam ou são abertas (por corrosão, por exemplo). Essa nova classe de baterias de íons de lítio pode ser produzida com materiais menos prejudiciais ao meio ambiente, como o óxido de manganês, grafite ou pirita mineral devidamente modificados, materiais que podem ser produzidos em grandes quantidades no Brasil. "O importante é que quando as baterias de íons de lítio vazarem, não estaremos introduzindo no solo produtos químicos tóxicos que contaminam lençóis freáticos", ressalta Rosolen. "Para produzir baterias de alta tecnologia no Brasil é preciso dar incentivos para a produção de seus componentes no país, e, principalmente, precisa ter gente formada nessa área saindo das universidades".

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents a structural and electrochemical study of A0.11V2O5.nH2O (A = Eu, Tb) and V2O5.nH2O prepared by sol-gel method. The xerogel compounds were submitted to two thermal treatments (T = 300oC and 400 oC). Structural characterization of the A0.11V2O5.nH2O powder was probed by X-ray diffraction (XRD), Fourier Transformed Infra-Red FTIR, X-ray absorption spectroscopy?XAS. Composite electrodes of LixA0.11V2O5.nH2O, PVDF were studied by cyclic voltammetry and cronopotenciometry (discharge/charge cycles). The electrochemical performance of electrodes was correlated with structural data. The V ions in the as prepared V2O5 xerogel are mostly in a pentavalent V5+ state. During lithium insertion V ions are partially reduced to V4+ and V3+ states upon Li intercalation. The results also show that low Li intercalation (x < 1) affects mostly O 2p-V 3d mixed states, whereas for higher Li intercalation (x > 1) this mechanism saturates and leads to Li2O formation that appear active electrochemically. Eu+3 and Tb+3 were not reduced by intercalation of lithium. The rare-earth improves the reversible capacity of electrode and kinetic of lithium intercalation of xerogel submitted to T = 300oC. The lithium intercalation sites are modified by the intercalation of the rare-earth in the xerogel. The rare-earth were bonded to H2O molecules present into xerogel structure. For Tb0.11V2O5.nH2O electrode was found the best electrochemical response. Tb0.11V2O5.nH2O presents a large potential plateau at 2.6V and reversible specific capacity about 350mAh.g-1 (3.5 ?2.0V cut-off). The reversible specific capacity of the V2O5.nH2O and Eu0.11V2O5.nH2O were 259 mAh.g-1 and 269 mAh.g-1, respectively. The Tb0.11V2O5.nH2O appears like a very promisor electrode for lithium intercalation devices (battery and electrocromic displays).
